title: SHOW and DESCRIBE commands for listings: New columns in output (Pending) | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: This behavior change is in the 2024_08 bundle.
For the current status of the bundle, refer to Bundle History.
When this behavior change bundle is enabled, the output of the following listing commands are changed:
When enabled, the output of these commands includes the following new columns:

Defines where a listing’s data is distributed in relation to the organization.
Possible values are EXTERNAL and INTERNAL.

Indicates whether the consumer can query the listing directly, without needing to
retrieve (GET) the listing and create a local database in their account. If set to TRUE,
the consumer can run queries directly on the data through the listing itself.

The provider profile for an organization. For an organizational listing,
this value is set to INTERNAL.

The unique identifier that represents a listing and its data product as one entity.
This value is either set by the provider or generated by Snowflake.
